content: {{knowledge objective |Identifiant=OIC-049-11-A |Item_parent=Normal and pathological puberty |Item_parent_short=Normal and pathological puberty |Rank=A |Title=Knowing how to interpret a growth curve |Description=None |Rubric=Positive diagnosis |Contributors= |Order=11}} Calculate annual growth rate, measure BMI

question.question: What is the most appropriate method to calculate the annual growth rate of a child?
question.option_a: By comparing the child's weight and height at the beginning and end of the year
question.option_b: By measuring the child's BMI at regular intervals and calculating the average annual rate of change
question.option_c: By using a growth chart to plot the child's height and weight over time
question.option_d: By comparing the child's height and weight to a standard growth curve for their age and sex
